next.name: Freedom of Heart is the Fruit (1st)

segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these five things, when developed and cultivated, lead to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu asubhānupassī kāye viharati, āhāre paṭikūlasaññī, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññī, sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī, maraṇasaññā kho panassa ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions, and has well established the perception of their own death.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These five things, when developed and cultivated, lead to the ending of defilements.”

segments.pli: Dve ca saññā dve vaḍḍhī ca,
